pullRequest.title: Pushdown DistinctLimitNode in Pinot Connector

nodes.bodyText: I didn't follow why distinct limit generates the same PQL as a regular limit ?

beforeCommit.message: Adding DistinctLimit pushdown support in Pinot Connector

afterCommit.message: Adding DistinctLimit pushdown support in Pinot Connector

nodes.bodyText: I think I have forgotten your old Pinot-SQL PR :-) -- but didn't we have a special derived class for the SQL generation ? Instead of using  if useSqlSyntax
What about the old group by columns already in the context ? If you don't expect them please assert accordingly
Again pardon my ignorance on the Pinot-SQL PR: But wasn't there a special derived test class to test the PQL one alone. This looks to be testing the PQL flow -- should it go in its own class ?
How about testing something with a distinct limit on top of an existing group by ? What about on top of an existing global aggregation ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -211,4 +216,27 @@ public void testDistinctSelection()
                 defaultSessionHolder,
                 ImmutableMap.of());
     }
+
+    @Override
+    @Test
+    public void testDistinctLimitPushdown()

nodes.bodyText: PinotQueryGeneratorContext.withAggregation has some special handling for the case when distinctCount is already pushed down. (Search for PINOT_DISTINCT_COUNT_FUNCTION_NAME). Can you make sure that this doesn't conflict with that. Thanks
nit: I somehow prefer having a clean else block here to denote that the SQL and PQL handling is different. I somehow missed that in my first read.
nit: Should we omit adding a helper method when it is used only once ? I think this can be inlined ?
Is it worth asserting that we are in sql mode here ?

nodes.bodyText: Correct me if I am wrong: But is this block of code duplicated ? If so, can we DRY it ?
nit: split this into multiple lines if possible please.
I think getExpectedDistinctOutput should only take the group by keys, because the aggregation is always unconditionally "count()". ie, this method should just return "count()".
